The evening is convened by Alan Crookham, Research Centre Manager, National Gallery; with special guests Arike Oke, Rambert Archive; and Erin Lee, National Theatre Archive. Would it be useful to investigate how others have made/are making the decision to adopt RDA and to consider the implications of not adopting RDA in the near future? If you have decided to adopt RDA, would it be [...] Diane McCourt 2015-03-09T12:57:55+00:00 2015-03-09T12:57:55+00:00 Capturing usage data - can you help? https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARLIS-LINK;37ca4d8e.1503 Dear ARLIS Linkers,<br><br>I\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdm trying to come up with a way of monitoring what gets used in our library but not issued to students .i.e. those items that students look at but do not borrow.<br><br>Does anyone have any examples of how you capture this type of usage? If you do what level of detail do you go to i.e. do you focus just on the number of items or do you want to know what subject area the material belongs to? [...] Amy Robinson 2015-03-09T11:32:12+00:00 2015-03-09T11:32:12+00:00 Planes, trains and automobiles: mechanical engineering archives now online https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARLIS-LINK;75f8769c.1503 Over 1700 images from the archives and historic book collection of the Institution of Mechanical Engineers (IMechE) are now available online via VADS at: http://www.vads.ac.uk/collections/IMECHE<br><br>The archive charts the history of the Institution and of mechanical engineering, covering topics from railways to manufacturing, spanning the late 1800's to the late 1900's. The post holder will provide specialist leadership and direction for a team of Learning & Teaching Librarians across all four UCA campuses. They will also take a strategic lead and operational oversight in developing, monitoring and evaluating Information Literacies and Research [...] announcements 2015-03-06T15:45:53+00:00 2015-03-06T15:45:53+00:00 ISKO UK evening meet-up 24th March - 2 weeks to book! https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARLIS-LINK;812b7adc.1503 ISKO UK invite you to this new style event on<br><br>Tuesday 24 March 2015 18:30-21:00<br><br>at CILIP<br>7 Ridgmount St,<br>London WC1E 7AE<br>[Location<br><http://www.cilip.org.uk/sites/default/files/documents/How%20to%20get%20to%20CILIP%20map_0.pdf>]<br><br>Join us at this first ever evening meetup event to celebrate the launch<br>of Facet Publishing's new "A Handbook for Corporate Information<br>Professionals". It gives a cutting-edge overview of the issues and<br>opportunities for information professionals in rapidly-changing<br>environments, and contains contributions from a wide range of sectors<br>and specialisms. [...] Stewart, Claire 2015-03-06T13:06:18+00:00 2015-03-06T13:06:18+00:00 Re: Shelf-ready books in the Art Library https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARLIS-LINK;fc365718.1503 Hello Nicky<br><br>Many thanks for your reply. The case of photography books is another classic example! One of the roots of the problem I'm experiencing is that our acquisitions is centralised at a different campus and so I'm not in direct contact with the suppliers. Unfortunately, the acquisitions manager is one of the proponents of the so-called 'accept the scatter' policy so I'm collecting as much evidence as I can from other institutions to support my case for a change in a procedure (ie actually allowing me to state the classmark on ordering!). [...] Stewart, Claire 2015-03-06T12:51:18+00:00 2015-03-06T12:51:18+00:00 Re: Shelf-ready books in the Art Library https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARLIS-LINK;c9ea4b15.1503 Hi Amanda<br><br>It is indeed helpful! It's great to know that the problem is recognised elsewhere and is overcome by very easy solutions. I now have the evidence that that amending marks is practiced across the sector (as I strongly suspected!)<br><br>Sorry, I should have clarified; the restrictions aren't because Dawson's actually change us extra for a change in classmark, but rather have been imposed by our managers as it is not seen as a fruitful use of staff time. However, the benefits to our users surely outweigh the cons in terms of additional staff time spent on changing a [...] Nicky Ransom 2015-03-06T12:03:48+00:00 2015-03-06T12:03:48+00:00 Re: Shelf-ready books in the Art Library https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARLIS-LINK;ef4ec4a1.1503 Hi Claire<br><br>We have an arrangement with our supplier of shelf ready books to cover the situations that you describe. For example, books of photographs from a particular geographic area will be classified with other books on photography, not books on that geographic area. Generally, this works really well, and we only get a few instances that slip through the net. Is it possible to have this discussion with your supplier? [...] Amanda Russell 2015-03-06T12:09:22+00:00 2015-03-06T12:09:22+00:00 Re: Shelf-ready books in the Art Library https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARLIS-LINK;f792ba32.1503 Hi We have had similar problems with Coutts - but I have the say at order stage if I want to/need to change the class mark and indicate it on the form as well we are not charged extra for this. It was grudgingly recognised by the powers that be here that one size does not fit all so policy is accordingly - I am surprised that Dawson are charging extra now for changes in class mark at order stage to imported bib. Records because they didn't when they were our suppliers before we changed. [...] Stewart, Claire 2015-03-06T11:55:56+00:00 2015-03-06T11:55:56+00:00 Shelf-ready books in the Art Library https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARLIS-LINK;eb9122e9.1503 Hello all and Happy Friday!<br><br>I would like to ask the collective wisdom of ARLIS if anyone has any experience to share regarding the acquisition of shelf-ready stock in an art library context?<br><br>At University of Cumbria, all in-print books are purchased shelf-ready from Dawson's in that they are ready- classified etc and pre-made catalogue records are imported. However, whilst this seems to work satisfactorily for other subject areas, in the library at our arts campus we notice a number of issues: [...] Katie Hambrook 2015-03-05T09:08:00+00:00 2015-03-05T09:08:00+00:00 LACA meeting https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARLIS-LINK;5141d2ce.1503 As the representative of ARLIS, I attended the latest meeting of LACA (the<br>Libraries and Archives Copyright Alliance) last week.<br><br>Following the new exceptions to copyright law brought in last summer, LACA<br>has issued a poster on copyright for libraries to use (with accompanying<br>briefing notes for library staff. These are available for downloading<br>from<br>http://www.cilip.org.uk/cilip/advocacy-campaigns-awards/advocacy-campaigns/copyright/briefings-resources/copyright-poster [...] Alessia Borri 2015-03-04T10:27:45+00:00 2015-03-04T10:27:45+00:00 TAKING THE PLUNGE-ART LIBRARIANSHIP AS A CAREER OPTION-20th April 2015-London, INIVA https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARLIS-LINK;ef086a32.1503 *with apologies for cross-posting*<br><br>TAKING THE PLUNGE: ART LIBRARIANSHIP AS A CAREER OPTION<br>ARLIS/UK & Ireland Workshop<br>DATE Monday 20th April 2015<br>TIME 10.00 \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd 16.00<br>VENUE Stuart Hall Library, Iniva, Rivington Place, London EC2A 3BA<br><br>The Arlis Professional Development Committee has organised this workshop, designed for new professionals, LIS students or anyone thinking about becoming an art librarian. The day includes many interesting presentations by experts in their field, and useful advice on how to present your CV in the best way. The event concludes with a tour of the Stuart Hall Library (INIVA). Please see the full programme [...] ARLIS Committee for Art and Design Archives 2015-03-03T20:35:30+00:00 2015-03-03T20:35:30+00:00 Copyright Study Day https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARLIS-LINK;360c0d76.1503 There are now just a few places left for 'Keeping Within the Lines: Approaches to Copyright in Art and Design Archives'<br><br>London Metropolitan Archives, London<br>Friday 13 March, 10.15am - 5pm<br><br>Organised by ARLIS/UK & Ireland, Committee for Art & Design Archives (CADA) in partnership with The National Archives and the \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdArchiving the Arts\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd initiative. Nielsen will be familiar to many of you through their work with libraries and publishers worldwide.<br><br>The visit will take place on Wednesday 18th March with a morning session (10.30-12.30pm) of talks and demonstrations. In addition, Nielsen Book have very kindly offered to provide lunch for anyone wishing to stay on for a more informal afternoon session, following up on points of interest from the morning, ending by 3pm at the latest. [...] Edward Bottoms 2015-02-27T11:18:05+00:00 2015-02-27T11:18:05+00:00 Architectural Association Collections: New Blog Announced https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARLIS-LINK;6c47780d.1502 Apologies for cross-posting but I thought members might be interested in a joint blog just launched by the Architectural Association Archives, Library and Photo Library:<br>http://collectionsblog.aaschool.ac.uk/<br>(where you can also subscribe for a fortnightly email version of the blog)<br><br>The blog is intended as a forum for notifying researchers of important new acquisitions or discoveries within the various collections. We will also be highlighting historic drawings, objects, photographs and books which have recently been catalogued or which have a topical relevance. [...] David Jenkins 2015-02-27T09:43:51+00:00 2015-02-27T09:43:51+00:00 Interiors (0020-5516) Vol. 146 https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARLIS-LINK;8bf32746.1502 Hullo,<br><br>Further to my last message, we have also lost Interiors (0020-5516) Vol. 146, 1-6 to water damage.<br><br>Please can I ask whether anybody has any unwanted copies of these issues they would be happy to give us?<br><br>Again, we would be very happy to pay the postage costs.<br><br>Thanks for your help!<br><br>Regards,<br><br>David. Alessia Borri 2015-02-27T09:17:41+00:00 2015-02-27T09:17:41+00:00 ARLIS visit to Goldsmiths Special Collections-FULLY BOOKED- https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARLIS-LINK;822283e2.1502 *with apologies for cross posting*<br><br>The ARLIS Professional Development Committee has organised a visit to Goldsmiths Special Collections, The Textile Collection and Women's Art Library, in London.<br><br>*PLEASE NOTE THAT THIS VISIT IS NOW FULLY BOOKED*<br><br>Alessia Borri<br>Assistant Academic Support Librarian<br><br>University of the Arts London<br>Chelsea College of Arts<br><br>E: a.borri@chelsea.arts.ac.uk<mailto:a.borri@chelsea.arts.ac.uk><br>T:0207 514 7901<br>@Chelsea_Library<br>[twitter-icon (1)]<https://twitter.com/UAL_Libraries> [facebook] <https://www.facebook.com/UALlibraries> [wordpress-icon] <http://blogs.arts.ac.uk/libraryservices/> [ask_us_icon_blue tinier] <http://arts.ac.libanswers.com/index.php> Alessia Borri 2015-02-26T14:12:33+00:00 2015-02-26T14:12:33+00:00 ARLIS visit to Goldsmiths College Special Collections, London. Friday 27 March 2015 https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARLIS-LINK;fb6e6e60.1502 *with apologies for cross posting*<br><br>The ARLIS Professional Development Committee has organised a visit to Goldsmiths College Special Collections, The Textile Collection and Women's Art Library, in London.<br><br>The visit will take place on Friday 27th March, 2pm - 4pm<br><br>Goldsmiths Textile Collection, founded in the 1980s by Constance Howard and Audrey Walker, comprises textile art, embroidery and dress from all continents. This global collection is complemented with a variety of teaching materials and archives, including technical and experimental samples and Constance Howard's own teaching archive. The Collection is housed in the Constance Howard Gallery, an AHRC-funded centre dedicated to [...] David Jenkins 2015-02-25T11:57:32+00:00 2015-02-25T11:57:32+00:00 Interior (0954-1438) https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARLIS-LINK;1d165fba.1502 Hullo,<br><br>Unfortunately, our December 2000/January 2001 copy of Interior (0954-1438) and its supplement, Trends From Spain, have been badly water damaged.<br><br>Please can I ask whether anybody has an unwanted copy they would be happy to give us?<br><br>We will pay the postage costs.<br><br>Thanks for your help!<br><br>Regards,<br><br>David. Aida Slavic 2015-02-24T13:59:47+00:00 2015-02-24T13:59:47+00:00 CFP Reminder: Classification and Authority Control: Expanding Resource Discovery - Lisbon, 29-30 October 2015 https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARLIS-LINK;870bf3bf.1502 *** Apologies for cross-posting ***<br><br>==== CALL FOR PAPERS (deadline 28 February) ====<br><br>International UDC Seminar 2015<br>CLASSIFICATION AND AUTHORITY CONTROL:<br>Expanding Resource Discovery<br><br>DATE: 29-30 October 2015<br>VENUE: National Library of Portugal<br>Campo Grande 83<br>Lisbon, Portugal<br>WEBSITE: http://seminar.udcc.org/2015/<br>CONTACT: seminar2015@udcc.org<br><br>Linked data practices and techniques have opened new possibilities in exploiting<br>controlled vocabularies and improving resource discovery. Authority data held in<br>library systems, including classification schemes find new ways of expanding its<br>potential as shared knowledge structures across the linked data environment.<br>The objective of this conference is to explore such a potential, expanding the<br>value and use [...] Fiona MacLellan 2015-02-24T13:37:39+00:00 2015-02-24T13:37:39+00:00 Adobe Creative Cloud https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARLIS-LINK;6cced7fd.1502 Hi All,<br>I'm trying to ascertain whether other institutions provide access to Adobe Creative Cloud (the Adobe Creative Suite replacement) for use by their students. In the past we had licences for Creative Suite, but the model and cost of Creative Cloud is causing us difficulty in terms of providing it on our computers in the library. [...] Jane Furness 2015-02-24T10:48:05+00:00 2015-02-24T10:48:05+00:00 Conference announcement: THE ARCHITECTURE OF SCOTLAND IN ITS EUROPEAN SETTING 1660-1750 https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARLIS-LINK;8b624fd1.1502 With apologies for cross-posting:<br><br>The University of Edinburgh and Historic Scotland are organising a conference, The Architecture of Scotland in its European Setting 1660-1750.<br><br>The website is available here: https://sites.eca.ed.ac.uk/architecture-of-scotland/<br><br>THE ARCHITECTURE OF SCOTLAND IN ITS EUROPEAN SETTING 1660-1750<br><br>22-25 April 2015, University of Edinburgh<br><br>This conference will review the architecture of Scotland's early classical period, 1660-1750, set against the backdrop of European sister cultures. It will re-examine the work of major Scottish architects including Sir William Bruce, Mr James Smith, the Mylne family, William Adam and their contemporaries: clients, garden designers and craftsmen. Topics explored will include country houses [...] Chris Fowler 2015-02-20T15:21:48+00:00 2015-02-20T15:21:48+00:00 Vandalised photobooks https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARLIS-LINK;c2ebd9fe.1502 Tom Nicolaou is a MA Photographic studies student at the University of<br>Westminster (and a member of staff at Oxford Brookes University). He's<br>looking at vandalised photobooks (specifically cut, torn or vandalised<br>images) and is trying to source out of circulation / damaged books for this<br>project.<br><br>Please contact Thomas on tom_nicuk@yahoo.co.uk if you think you can help<br>Thomas out with his research. He would be willing to pay for postage of any<br>books that are no longer in circulation. [...] Nicholas Brown 2015-02-19T12:57:01+00:00 2015-02-19T12:57:01+00:00 ARLIS visit to the Stuart Hall Library at Iniva - 9th March - 3.30 pm https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARLIS-LINK;f1472b79.1502 *with many apologies for cross posting*<br><br>The ARLIS Professional Development Committee has organised a visit to The Stuart Hall Library at Iniva (Institute of International Visual Arts) in Shoreditch, London.<br><br>The library facilitates and promotes research into issues of cultural identity in the visual arts. The Library is named in honour of the sociologist Stuart Hall, and his ideas of culture as a contested critical space of intervention inform the development of the collection. In keeping with this, the library collects around visual arts which engage with subjects including post-colonialism, race, gender and sexual identities, and work which questions the [...] Dora Coventry 2015-02-18T10:02:44+00:00 2015-02-18T10:02:44+00:00 Sir Banister Fletcher's A History of Architecture, 21st Edition https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARLIS-LINK;b70489f6.1502 **PRESS RELEASE**<br><br>Coming in 2017<br>Sir Banister Fletcher's A History of Architecture, 21st Edition<br>Bloomsbury Publishing has signed an agreement with the Royal Institute of British Architects (RIBA) and the University of London to Publish Sir Banister Fletcher's A History of Architecture, 21st Edition<br><br>We are very pleased to announce the future publication of Sir Banister Fletcher's A History of Architecture, 21st Edition, a landmark new edition of a long-standing classic providing the most authoritative and up-to-date account of the history of the world's architecture.<br>Alongside a high-quality print edition planned for publication in autumn 2017, Banister Fletcher will make [...] Diana Wood 2015-02-18T09:41:56+00:00 2015-02-18T09:41:56+00:00 Art sales/valuation websites https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARLIS-LINK;88cef3db.1502 Dear all,<br><br>I've been asked by colleagues to look into subscribing to art<br>sales/valuations websites. I was wondering if anyone else has had to do<br>this, and whether there are particular sites they would recommend (or<br>recommend avoiding!)?<br><br>Thanks for any advice,<br><br>Diana Caulfield Maxine Miller 2015-02-13T15:30:23+00:00 2015-02-13T15:30:23+00:00 Amended details: Archival Explorations and Spaces of Black Modernism - Tate Library and Archive Show and Tell in the Archive Reading Room at Tate Britain on Friday 20 February 2015 https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARLIS-LINK;2e81024a.1502 Dear all,<br><br>Here are details of the Library and Archive Show and Tell in the Archive Reading Room at Tate Britain on Friday 20 February. We will explore open access, auditing, peer-reviewing and critique, and the tug of war between science, magic and art on the issue of love.
